seniority_level.evidence: 12+ years of experience required, which aligns with senior level in data engineering roles

job_family.evidence: Job title is 'Data Engineer-Data Modeling', and responsibilities focus on data modeling, architecture, and warehousing

sub_specialty.evidence: Core focus on data modeling, dimensional modeling, and data governance; tools like Erwin and IBM Infosphere Data Architect are modeling-specific

leadership_expectation.evidence: No mention of people management, team leadership, or architectural oversight beyond individual contribution; responsibilities are technical and collaborative

primary_cloud.evidence: No cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) mentioned in job description or Pass 1 extraction

secondary_clouds.evidence: No cloud platforms mentioned at all

processing_paradigm.evidence: Focus on data modeling, warehousing, and ETL-like activities (cleansing, integrating data) implies batch processing; no streaming tools mentioned

orchestrator_category.evidence: No orchestration tools (Airflow, Dagster, etc.) mentioned

storage_layer.evidence: Explicit mention of data warehousing concepts and dimensional modeling; relational databases emphasized

remote_restriction.evidence: Location specified as Pune, Maharashtra, India; onsite work model implies regional restriction

timezone_focus.evidence: Location restricted to India (Pune), no mention of global or multi-timezone teams

relocation_required.evidence: Onsite work model + specific location (Pune) implies relocation may be required if not already based there

h1b_friendly.evidence: No visa sponsorship mentioned; location is India, not US, so H1B not applicable

opt_cpt_friendly.evidence: Location is India; OPT/CPT are US-specific student visas, not relevant here

citizenship_required.evidence: Must be resident in India (per geo restriction); implies local work authorization required, no citizenship requirement stated

w2_vs_1099.evidence: Full-time permanent employment stated; typical for W2 in India/IBM context

benefits_level.evidence: No benefits listed in Pass 1 extraction or job description

growth_path_clarity.evidence: Mentions 'collaborative environment' and 'deep technical expertise' but no explicit career tracks or promotion paths

mentorship_signals.evidence: Mentions partnering with scientists, engineers, consultants, and DBAs of all backgrounds — implies learning from experienced team members

promotion_path_mentioned.evidence: No mention of promotions, advancement, or career progression in job description or Pass 1

internal_mobility_mentioned.evidence: No mention of internal transfers, role changes, or mobility options

career_tracks_available.evidence: No explicit mention of IC, management, or specialist tracks; inferred from IBM’s general structure but not stated

requirement_strictness.evidence: All skills listed are 'must have' (no nice-to-haves); 12+ years experience required; specific tools and concepts mandated

scope_definition.evidence: Focused on data modeling, architecture, and warehousing; responsibilities are well-defined and role-specific

skill_inflation_detected.evidence: 12+ years experience aligns with senior data modeling role; skills are specific and realistic for that level
